subject: Add app_launcher binary to provide this feature
commitMessage:
Add app_launcher binary to provide this feature

Usage : app_launcher
-h --help Display this usage information.
-l --list Display installed apps list
-S --status Display running apps list
-s [tizen application ID] --start Launch application with tizen application ID
-k [tizen application ID] --kill Kill application with tizen application ID
-r [tizen application ID] --is-running Check whether application is running by tizen application ID,
If application is running, 0(zero) will be returned.
-d --debug Activate debug mode
BUG-Tizen:TC-1883

Change-Id: Iea647fc6cb24e22c1537c6322dcac6f66cd487ad
Signed-off-by: Baptiste DURAND <baptiste.durand@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Modification about smack label of db file belong to process.
commitMessage:
Modification about smack label of db file belong to process.

[Problem] 
Most db files have 'floor' label.  Because these are created during image creation time.
Therefore no process can write the dbs (since 'floor' label allows only read and execute)

[Solution] 
Modify smack label of the db files based on condition below referring three domain model
Condition1. Assign domain of process which creates db files
Condition2. Assign domain of process accesses db files.

Change-Id: I705b4f646ad3f9e41f014573c8cebfbabc8bdcd8

subject: Multi-user implementation feature

owner.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

commitMessage:
Multi-user implementation feature

- Desactivate preload features
- Create am_agent process
- Remove old launchpad daemon
- Make am_agent discuss with amd process to launch an app
- Add Crosswalk Launchpad capabilities
- renamed am_agent to am_session_agent; fix segfault in amd_session_agent after first app launch
- cleanup agent code, added uid in amd request to agent
- Fix build with Cosswalk and add Dbus call
- fix build; added specific dlog tag for agent
- fix caller_uid check in agent
- Use DBUS SESSION bus instead of DBUS SYSTEM bus
- amd_session_agent now sends an APP_DEAD_SIGNAL request to amd daemon to signal the end of an app
- Fix Error Management
- amd: check that sender of APP_DEAD_SIGNAL is /usr/bin/amd_session_agent
- Add systemd service
- Add User Management for get applications ,Remove DBUS launch mechanism
- get uid for multiuser support

more info : https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Multi-user_Architecture

subject: Change /tmp/amd_ready to /run/amd_ready
commitMessage:
Change /tmp/amd_ready to /run/amd_ready

/tmp/amd_ready file was used for path activation in the systemd user session.
Path is changed to /run/amd_ready to fix issue on SMACK label issue and
to use the right directory for the purpose.

Change-Id: Iceb5e61e5956cc367f5501a09cd727c76b76c177
Signed-off-by: Semun Lee <sm79.lee@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

The directory should be labeled "System::Shared", not "_". This allows the process that manages the data (running at "System") to modify it at will. If "User" processes need to see the data the directory needs to be transmuting as well.

Patch Set 1:

/tmp/amd_ready is not a directory and is not needed to be modified by System processes. Actually, it doesn't need to be modified after it is created. That's why I set the label as '_' intentionally. Should I label as System::Shared in this case?

Patch Set 1:

If this isn't a temporary file, why is it in /tmp? Why isn't it in /etc?

Patch Set 1:

This file is temporary file to notify the amd daemon is ready to provide it's functionality.
It is not proper to write to /etc because it is only meaningful for a specific boot session.

Patch Set 1:

The right place for this kind of file is /run, not /tmp. If you move it to /run your problems will be over.

Patch Set 1:

I agree. However, /tmp/amd_ready is being used by systemd units of other modules, so, modifying the path of this file cause many changes for other modules.
Please, note that this labeling is for making the mobile binary to work properly with the three domain model to start developing Tizen 3.0 for mobile.
I have plan to make the amd to work with socket activation of systemd later, not with this amd_ready file.

Patch Set 1:

Yes, I understand that other modules will expect /tmp/amd_ready. They will have to be fixed too, because they are not using the filesystem namespace correctly either. I had a pass through the Tizen 3 tree and I don't find /tmp/amd_ready used anywhere outside the am_daemon. I will look deeper, but I think changing this may be easy.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

I've changed the path to /run/amd_ready.
Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Please read the three domain model wiki page.

Because /run is transmuting you don't need to set the label on the file. That will get done for you. Remove the code that sets the label and you will be fine.
Uploaded patch set 3.
Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Patch Set 3:

Well, /run is not transmuted BTW.

Patch Set 3:

/run is transmuting in the IVI and common profiles. There appears to be a problem with chsmack, which does not report that /run has the transmute attribute. I expect this is related to /run being the root of a filesystem.

 # mkdir /run/foo

results in /run/foo labeled System::Run on both IVI and common. Please check it on Mobile. If it does not work, you are either missing an up to date systemd configuration or a kernel that does not support the transmute attribute on mountpoints.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Better, thank you.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: init wayland support.
commitMessage:
init wayland support.

The display server based on X or Wayland, is now a choice of different profile in Tizen 3.0.
Basically and consistently, two macros were used "with wayland" and "with x".
Below summarize the combination of the macros:

| wayland |  x  | meaning
|---------------------------
|   0     |  1  | pure X11 platform(no wayland)
|   1     |  0  | pure wayland platform (no X11)
|   1     |  1  | wayland but X compatibility
|   0     |  0  | no X and no wayland

This method unifies the meaning and usage. Deploy this method to aul-1 package.
Currently we need "pure wayland platform (no X11)" status,so "with wayland" and "with x" are
defined into "1" and "0" in build.conf file.If you need other status of above illustration,
please change values of "with x" and "with wayland" in your build.conf file.

Signed-off-by: wangfei <feix.w.wang@intel.com>
Change-Id: I50cbee1ae458ac49bd0ffc839f65f4c7fb11ac9b

subject: Fix PTREL-624
commitMessage:
Fix PTREL-624

launchpad-preload@app.service set a wrong XDG_RUNTIME_DIR
environment.

We use new unit (user-session-launch@.service ) and symbol link
(user-session-launch@seat0-5000.service) to auto-trigger a user
session. This results in a environment
"XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=/run/user/5000" in the user session. But the
lauchpad service still use symbol link
"launchpad-preload@app.service" which result in a environment
"XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=/run/user/app". This make XDG_RUMTIME_DIR
dismatch between app launched by launchpad and program, e.g.
weston, launched in user session. And hence app launched by
launchpad failed at connecting socket /run/user/5000/wayland-0
that created by weston.

Change-Id: I7896dd001e9602772d96f4a20057cd90369a3a9f
Signed-off-by: Alex Wu <zhiwen.wu@linux.intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

One thing I want to make sure is XDG_RUNTIME_DIR is necessary? weston does care XDG_RUNTIME_DIR environment of applications launched by aul?

Patch Set 1:

Yes, XDG_RUNTIME_DIR is necessary for both weston and its client.They communicate each other through the socket "$XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/wayland-0", which is created by weston.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

OK, sounds make sense, if you can add this background into commit msg that would be great. So the others from source code won't miss this important infomation

subject: Fix: amd will crash if ecore_x_init() failed
commitMessage:
Fix: amd will crash if ecore_x_init() failed

if ecore_x_init() failed, then its internal variable _ecore_x_disp is
NULL and will cause crash in _key_init().

Bug: https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/PTREL-137
Change-Id: I116fca62b35cc38a7ff14036ecf726000770f4b0
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           failed
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Patch Set 1:

Isn't this just masking the real issue... specifically that ecore_x_init has failed for some reason?  Wouldn't this just result in an unknown number of additional, hard to debug failures resulting from the original failure condition?

Patch Set 1:

Rusty, yes, this is a point. However, from my point I got.

1. this is not the single place to init ecore x

2. a debug output added to track ecore x init event.

3. the program should robust, to handle various errors.

4. we need fix the real init failure issue in ecore.

Patch Set 1:

sorry, false the first cent. I just found the root cause of ecore_x_init failure.

It need DISPLAY environment to open X connection.

Patch Set 1:

This happens a lot of time. Most of daemons requires DISPLAY variable if it has X dependency. /run/tizen-mobile-ui EnvironmentFile provildes the information on the previous version.

Patch Set 1:

Yes, we need maintainers sync the code.

Patch Set 1:

The fact that the real issue was a missing environment and not a bug in ecore is a perfect example of why this type of patch is the wrong thing to do.

It is not ecore's job to setup a valid environment, and when something so low a level as ecore_x_init fails then its a sign that something is seriously wrong with the universe and an appropriate action would be to fail very loudly so that the real issue is easier to discover.  In the kernel the policy would be to panic.

Patch Set 1:

Yes, if it should be treated as a critical issue. There we have to thinking who should through out that bail. From my point of view, it always should be ecore, giving that it provides API to manipulate a internal variable but didn't check the internal variable well, so the other users may crash into it.

However, as a better user, it's fine we do check of function returns and not depends on the low level API to do everything right for us.

Anyway, can maintainer merge this? or fail this? It's critical for tizen 3.0 mobile bootup.

Patch Set 1:

Filed a bug to track this kind of frangibility of ecore. See https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/PTREL-151
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Restore previously lost fix to systemd unit file
commitMessage:
Restore previously lost fix to systemd unit file

* change the name of the env file to reflect the fact that this
  service is shared across all profiles.  The actual env file is
  created in a platform specific manager, allowing platform specific
  environment variables
* use "=-" when declaring the env file so the service will start even
  if the env file does not exist
* remove hard coding DISPLAY environment. if mobile still needs this
  hack then add it to the environment file

Change-Id: I1279224990f1bc176e750b24945fa9734ae45d00
Signed-off-by: Rusty Lynch <rusty.lynch@intel.com>

subject: Init local variable to avoid crash if loading pkg info failed
commitMessage:
Init local variable to avoid crash if loading pkg info failed

The uninitialized local variable will cause amd crash (coredump) at
g_hash_table_foreach since the junk pointer in amd.af, this is triggered
by pkg info load failure from pkgmgr.

Change-Id: I1145c11dc88030b40834de769de1443786ca5dda
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

subject: packaging: fix errors in %preun and %postun scriptlets
commitMessage:
packaging: fix errors in %preun and %postun scriptlets

- If /sbin/ldconfig is not the only action for a scriptlet, the -p
  option should not be used.

- If the 'with multi user' option is not true, the shell conditional
  will be invalid.

This commit fixes both issues.

Change-Id: Ia610aad0576b9132a60f26063cbb35345ed58f92

subject: Add build time config for privacy-manager support
commitMessage:
Add build time config for privacy-manager support

The Tizen 2.1 code has a circular dependancy between aul and
the privacy-manager-client package.  Adding this build config
allows the cycle to be broke by first building aul without a
dep on privacy manager
